A-little-something-on-the-side.description: At the end of each downtime phase, you earn +2 stash.
A-little-something-on-the-side.label: A Little Something on the Side

Alchemist.description:
When you invent or craft a creation with alchemical features, take +1 result level to your roll.
You begin with one special formula already known.
Alchemist.label: Alchemist

Ambush.description: When you attack from hiding or spring a trap, you get +1d.
Ambush.label: Ambush

Analyst.description: During downtime, you get two ticks to distribute among any long-term project clocks that involve investigation or learning a new formula or design plan.
Analyst.label: Analyst

Artificer.description:
When you invent or craft a creation with spark-craft features, take +1 result level to your roll.
You begin with one special design already known.
Artificer.label: Artificer

Battleborn.description: You may expend your special armor to reduce harm from an attack in combat or to push yourself during a fight.
Battleborn.label: Battleborn

Bodyguard.description:
When you protect a teammate, take +1d to your resistance roll.
When you gather info to anticipate possible threats in the current situation, you get +1 effect.
Bodyguard.label: Bodyguard

Calculating.description: Due to your careful planning, during downtime, you may give yourself or another crew member +1 downtime action.
Calculating.label: Calculating

Cloak-and-dagger.description:
When you use a disguise or other form of covert misdirection, you get +1d to rolls to confuse or deflect suspicion.
When you throw off your disguise, the resulting surprise gives you the initiative in the situation.
Cloak-and-dagger.label: Cloak & Dagger

Compel.description:
You can Attune to the ghost field to force a nearby ghost to appear and obey a command you give it.
You are not supernaturally terrified by a ghost you summon or compel (though your allies may be).
Compel.label: Compel

Connected.description: During downtime, you get +1 result level when you acquire an asset or reduce heat.
Connected.label: Connected

Daredevil.description: When you roll a desperate action, you get +1d to your roll if you also take -1d to any resistance rolls against consequences from your action.
Daredevil.label: Daredevil

Expertise.description: Choose one of your action ratings. When you lead a group action using that action, you can suffer only 1 stress at most regardless of the number of failed rolls.
Expertise.label: Expertise

Focused.description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence of surprise or mental harm (fear, confusion, losing track of someone) or to push yourself for ranged combat or tracking.
Focused.label: Focused

Foresight.description:
Two times per score you can assist a teammate without paying stress.
Say how you prepared for this.
Foresight.label: Foresight

Fortitude.description:
You may expend your special armor to do one of the following:
  • Resist a consequence of fatigue, weakness, or chemical effects.
  • Push yourself when working with technical skill or handling alchemicals.
Fortitude.label: Fortitude

Functioning-vice.description:
When you indulge your vice, you may adjust the dice outcome by 1 or 2 (up or down).
An ally who joins in your vice may do the same.
Functioning-vice.label: Functioning Vice

Ghost-contract.description: When you shake on a deal, you and your partner—human or otherwise—both bear a mark of your oath. If either breaks the contract, they take level 3 harm, Cursed.
Ghost-contract.label: Ghost Contract

Ghost-fighter.description:
You may imbue your hands, melee weapons, or tools with spirit energy.
  • You gain potency in combat vs. the supernatural.
  • You may grapple with spirits to restrain and capture them.
Ghost-fighter.label: Ghost Fighter

Ghost-hunter-2.description:
Choose an additional arcane ability for your pet.
The Ghost Hunter ability is required to take this ability.
Ghost-hunter-2.label: Ghost Hunter +

Ghost-hunter.description:
Your hunting pet is imbued with spirit energy.
  • It gains potency when tracking or fighting the supernatural.
  • It gains one arcane ability: ghost-form, mind-link, or arrow-swift.
Ghost-hunter.label: Ghost Hunter

Ghost-mind.description:
You're always aware of supernatural entities in your presence.
Take +1d when you gather info about the supernatural.
Ghost-mind.label: Ghost Mind

Ghost-veil.description:
You may shift partially into the ghost field, becoming shadowy and insubstantial for a few moments.
Take 2 stress when you shift, plus 1 stress for each extra feature:
  • It lasts for a few minutes rather than moments.
  • You are invisible rather than shadowy.
  • You may float through the air like a ghost.
Ghost-veil.label: Ghost Veil

Ghost-voice.description:
You know the secret method to interact with a ghost or demon as if it was a normal human, regardless of how wild or feral it appears.
You gain potency when communicating with the supernatural.
Ghost-voice.label: Ghost Voice

Ghost-ward.description: You know how to Wreck an area with arcane substances and methods so it is either anathema or enticing to spirits (your choice).
Ghost-ward.label: Ghost Ward

Infiltrator.description: You are not affected by quality or Tier when you bypass security measures.
Infiltrator.label: Infiltrator

Iron-will.description:
You're immune to the terror that some supernatural entities inflict on sight.
Take +1d to resistance rolls with Resolve.
Iron-will.label: Iron Will

Jail-bird.description:
When incarcerated:
  • Your wanted level counts as 1 less
  • Your Tier counts as 1 more
  • You gain +1 faction status with a faction you help on the inside (in addition to your incarceration roll).
Jail-bird.label: Jail Bird

Leader.description:
When you Command a cohort in combat, they continue to fight when they would otherwise break (they're not taken out when they suffer level 3 harm).
They gain +1 effect and 1 armor.
Leader.label: Leader

Like-looking-into-a-mirror.description: You can always tell when someone is lying to you.
Like-looking-into-a-mirror.label: Like Looking into a Mirror

Mastermind.description: You may expend your special armor to protect a teammate, or to push yourself when you gather information or work on a long-term project.
Mastermind.label: Mastermind

Mesmerism.description: When you Sway someone, you may cause them to forget that it's happened until they next interact with you.
Mesmerism.label: Mesmerism

Not-to-be-trifled-with.description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of physical force that verges on the superhuman—engage a small gang on equal footing in close combat.
Not-to-be-trifled-with.label: Not to be Trifled With

Occultist.description: You know the secret ways to Consort with ancient powers, forgotten gods or demons. Once you've consorted with one, you get +1d to command cultists who worship it.
Occultist.label: Occultist

Physicker.description:
You can Tinker with bones, blood, and bodily humours to treat wounds or stabilize the dying.
You may study a malady or corpse.
Everyone in your crew gets +1d to their healing treatment rolls.
Physicker.label: Physicker

Reflexes.description: When there's a question about who acts first, the answer is you (two characters with Reflexes act simultaneously).
Reflexes.label: Reflexes

Ritual.description:
You can Study an occult ritual (or create a new one) to summon a supernatural effect or being.
You know the arcane methods to perform ritual sorcery.
You begin with one ritual already learned.
Ritual.label: Ritual

Rooks-gambit.description:
Take 2 stress to roll your best action rating while performing a different action.
Say how you adapt your skill to this use.
Rooks-gambit.label: Rook's Gambit

Saboteur.description: When you Wreck, the work is much quieter than it should be and the damage is hidden from casual inspection.
Saboteur.label: Saboteur

Savage.description:
When you unleash physical violence, it's especially frightening.
When you Command a frightened target, take +1d.
Savage.label: Savage

Scout.description:
When you gather info to locate a target, you get +1 effect.
When you hide in a prepared position or use camouflage, you get +1d to rolls to avoid detection.
Scout.label: Scout

Shadow.description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from detection or security measures, or to push yourself for a feat of athletics or stealth.
Shadow.label: Shadow

Sharpshooter.description:
You can push yourself to do one of the following:
  • Make a ranged attack at extreme distance beyond what's normal for the weapon.
  • Unleash a barrage of rapid fire to suppress the enemy.
Sharpshooter.label: Sharpshooter

Strange-methods.description:
When you invent or craft a creation with arcane features, take +1 result level to your roll.
You begin with one arcane design already known.
Strange-methods.label: Strange Methods

Subterfuge.description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from suspicion or persuasion, or to push yourself for subterfuge.
Subterfuge.label: Subterfuge

Survivor.description:
From hard-won experience or occult ritual, you are immune to the poisonous miasma of the deathlands and are able to subsist on the strange flora and fauna there.
You get +1 stress box.
Survivor.label: Survivor

Tempest.description:
You can push yourself to do one of the following:
  • Unleash a stroke of lightning as a weapon.
  • Summon a storm in your immediate vicinity (torrential rain, roaring winds, heavy fog, chilling frost/snow, etc.).
Tempest.label: Tempest

The-devils-footsteps.description:
When you push yourself, choose one of the following additional benefits:
  • Perform a feat of athletics that verges on the superhuman.
  • Maneuver to confuse your enemies so they mistakenly attack each other.
The-devils-footsteps.label: The Devil's Footsteps

Tough-as-nails.description:
Penalties from harm are one level less severe.
Level 4 harm is still fatal.
Tough-as-nails.label: Tough as Nails

Trust-in-me.description: You get +1d versus a target with whom you have an intimate relationship.
Trust-in-me.label: Trust in Me

Vengeful.description:
You gain an additional xp trigger: You got payback against someone who harmed you or someone you care about.
If your crew helped you get payback, also mark crew xp.
Vengeful.label: Vengeful

Venomous.description:
Choose a drug or poison (from your bandolier stock) to which you have become immune.
You can push yourself to secrete it through your skin or saliva or exhale it as a vapor.
Venomous.label: Venomous

Vigorous.description:
You recover from harm faster. Permanently fill in one of your healing clock segments.
Take +1d to healing treatment rolls.
Vigorous.label: Vigorous

Warded.description: You may expend your special armor to resist a supernatural consequence, or to push yourself when you deal with arcane forces.
Warded.label: Warded

Weaving-the-web.description:
You gain +1d to Consort when you gather information on a target for a score.
You get +1d to the engagement roll for that operation.
Weaving-the-web.label: Weaving the Web

Attune.description: Attune to spirits and the ghost field; channel electroplasmic energy; perceive and communicate with ghosts; understand spectrology.
Attune.label: Attune

Command.description: Command obedience with your force of personality; intimidate or threaten; lead an action with one of the crew's gangs.
Command.label: Command

Consort.description: Consort with connections from your heritage, background, friends, or rivals to gain access to resources, information, people, or places.
Consort.label: Consort

Finesse.description: Finesse an item from someone's pocket; employ subtle misdirection or sleight-of-hand; handle a vehicle or a mount.
Finesse.label: Finesse

Hunt.description: Hunt a target; gather information about its location and movements; attack with precision shooting from a distance.
Hunt.label: Hunt

Prowl.description: Prowl about unseen and traverse obstacles; climb, swim, run, jump, and tumble. Ambush with close violence—a backstab, throat cutting, black-jack, etc.
Prowl.label: Prowl

Skirmish.description: Skirmish with an opponent in close combat; assault or hold a position; brawl and wrestle.
Skirmish.label: Skirmish

Study.description: Study a person, document, or item with close scrutiny to gather information and apply knowledge; gain a deeper understanding; do research.
Study.label: Study

Survey.description: Survey a location or situation to understand what's going on; sense trouble before it happens; gather information about opportunities or exploits.
Survey.label: Survey

Sway.description: Sway someone with charm, logic, deception, disguise, or bluff; change attitudes or behavior with manipulation or seduction.
Sway.label: Sway

Tinker.description: Tinker with mechanisms to create, modify, disable, or repair; disable a trap, pick a lock, or crack a safe. Use electroplasmic devices.
Tinker.label: Tinker

Wreck.description: Wreck a place, item, or obstacle with savage force or carefully applied sabotage; breach defenses with force; create distractions and chaos.
Wreck.label: Wreck

Academic.description: A scholar, a professor or student from Doskvol Academy, a philosopher or journalist, etc.
Academic.label: Academic

Labor.description: A servant, a factory worker, a coach driver, a docker, a sailor, a Rail Jack, etc. A stevedore for the North Hook Company.
Labor.label: Labor

Law.description: An advocate or barrister, a Bluecoat or inspector (or even Spirit Warden), a prison guard from Ironhook, etc.
Law.label: Law

Military.description: An Imperial or Skovlander soldier, a mercenary, an intelligence operative, a strategist, a training instructor, etc.
Military.label: Military

Noble.description: A dilettante, a courtier, the scion of a fallen house, etc.
Noble.label: Noble

Trade.description: A shopkeeper, a merchant, a skilled crafts-person, a shipping agent, etc. A liaison to the Ministry of Preservation.
Trade.label: Trade

Underworld.description: A street urchin, gang member, young thug, or other outcast who grew up on the streets.
Underworld.label: Underworld

Akoros.description: The largest and most industrialized land in the Imperium, and home to the capital city as well as Duskwall itself. They're known as a diverse conglomeration of cultures, somewhat like Europe.
Akoros.label: Akoros

Dagger-isles.description: People in the Dagger Isles often grow up on ships and travel a lot before settling down. They're known as corsairs and merchants who live without lightning barriers, dealing with spirits in other ways.
Dagger-isles.label: Dagger Isles

Iruvia.description: A rich and powerful desert kingdom far to the south. A diverse land of varying cultures similar to old Persia, Egypt, and India.
Iruvia.label: Iruvia

Severos.description: Most Severosi live in nomadic horse-tribes scattered across the blasted deathlands, surviving within the ruins of ancient arcane fortresses which still repel spirits.
Severos.label: Severos

Skovlan.description: A cold and rugged island kingdom just across the sea from Duskwall. Skovlan was last to be brought under Imperial rule, over the course of the Unity War, which ended only a few years ago.
Skovlan.label: Skovlan

Tycheros.description: A semi-mythical place far away beyond the northern Void Sea. It's said the people there are part-demon. If you choose Tycherosi heritage, also create a demonic tell that marks your character.
Tycheros.label: Tycheros
